Lair of the Leviathan

cornell/tpeg | Date: May 2018

With a team of three students from the Cal Poly Amusement Park Engineers and Designers (CAPED), I designed a water ride themed after a dilapidated tourist attraction and an encounter with a mysterious sea creature. This ride was conceptualized over the course of one month for the 2018 Cornell Theme Park Design Competition.

Skills and contributions:

  • Conceptualization, story, and design of a themed water attraction
  • Collaboration with a team in a cohesive manner under time-sensitive constraints
  • Lore writing, world building, and character design/development
  • Ride mechanic development according to ASTM F24 standards
  • Master site planning given spacial constraints
